intro: Galium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium balearicum is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is considered a rare species in some areas.
